poem:
**Solingen Night**

In Solingen's heart,  
a blade's cruel whisper—  
three lives silenced,  
eight breaths staggered.  
By moon's pallid gleam,  
witnesses cry out,  
their voices lost  
in the shatter of dreams.  
A festival of diversity—  
now a tapestry of sorrow,  
woven with threads  
of a night never to end.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Solingen stabbings: what we know so far A manhunt is under way after three people were killed in a mass stabbing at a festival in Solingen in Germany on Friday night. Here is what we know so far: Three people have been killed and eight injured in a knife attack at a diversity festival in the western German city of Solingen, police said. Witnesses alerted police shortly after 9.30pm on Friday night to an unknown". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
